column1: Distal renal tubular acidosis is a disease that occurs when the kidneys do not properly remove acids from the blood into the urine.
Distal renal tubular acidosis (Type I RTA) is caused by a defect in the kidney tubes that causes acid to build up in the blood.
The doctor will perform a physical exam and ask about your symptoms.
This will help correct bone disorders and reduce calcium buildup in the kidneys (nephrocalcinosis) and kidney stones.
